title: Deadeye

embed.description: The Palace Isles The Palace Isles Three in every ocean Anarchy Isle The Isle Joy The Isles War and Power, Eye . . .

body:
There has been a lot of things going on about this deadeye. Lets make some things clear:

1: Deadeye, means an expert marksman, so the new champion is a marksman
2: A poem found by other people tells that the jhinn is a deadeye, also an expert marksman
3: The people the jhinn killed all had lost memories,so they were probably seen by the jhinn.

Just a few facts ^_^{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

replies.body:
You really should have given context to the Djinn Poems to Her Majesty. Anyone who has not seen the Brofresco video will be confused about this I think.

+ {{champion:254}}** Vi:**
_"Hands of the Juggernaut
care not to squash me in your grasp
I may be a champion warlord
but my brawn is clay in your titanium grip"_

+ {{champion:37}} **Sona: **
_"Play ye me a melodic tune
from your wonderful instrument
I am an admirer of your hymm
Your song entices me
young and skillful craftswoman"
_

+ **Jhin:**
_"The accuracy of your aim
has gained you the title dead eye
and every man pleas not to be
the object of your fury"_

+ {{champion:86}} **Garen:**
_"You shall be the first to handle
those deaded tools of tyranny
for you have the heart
of the overprotective mother"_

Usually the fact that Zed is missing and the strange source would usually be enough to debunk this theory, but in this case there is too much specific evidence for this to be a mere coincidence:

1. Refers to Vi's grip as titanium, not rock, diamond or any other hard non-metal. 
2. Refers to Sona as a crafts**woman**.
3. Jhin is said to have the title dead eye.
4. Garen's verse mentions heart, which is the organ that was pierced in the teaser.

Also something you said reminded me of something

_"The people the jhinn killed all had lost memories, so they were probably seen by the jhinn."_
_
"For your hand is the hand
that holds the key
to the gates of limbo"_

Maybe you picked up on this as well but there is a book called **The Six Gates from Limbo**. It's a story about a guy named Rex who awakens in a strange paradise disoriented and **without memories. **The whole story is about him uncovering his past and why he is there.

He could also be referring to Limbo as the first layer of hell, as it is described in Dante's Inferno.

Just wanted to add a bit to your ideas. Great stuff BTW looks right on point.
Oh, and its number 63 that has the poem about deadeye
